dbi.Row

class Row;
Provide access to a single row in a result set.

char[] opIndex(int idx);
Get a field's contents by index.

Params:
int idx Field index.

Examples:
(begin code) Row row = res.fetchRow(); printf("first=%.*s, last=%.*s\n", row[0], row[1]); (end code)

Returns:
The field's contents.

char[] opIndex(char[] name);
Get a field's contents by field name.

Params:
char[] name Field name.

Example:
(begin code) Row row = res.fetchRow(); printf("first=%.*s, last=%.*s\n", row["first"], row["last"]); (end code)

Returns:
The field's contents.

char[] get(int idx);
Get a field's contents by index.

Params:
int idx Field index.

Returns:
The field's contents.

char[] get(char[] name);
Get a field's contents by field name.

Params:
char[] name Field name.

Returns:
The field's contents.

int getFieldIndex(char[] name);
Get a field's index by field name.

Params:
char[] name Field name.

Returns:
The field's index.

int getFieldType(int idx);
Get the field type.

Params:
int idx Field index.

Returns:
The field's type.

char[] getFieldDecl(int idx);
Get a field's SQL declaration.

Params:
int idx Field index.

Returns:
The field's SQL declaration.

void addField(char[] name, char[] value, char[] decl, int type);
Add a new field to this row.

Params:
char[] name Name.
char[] value Value.
char[] decl SQL declaration, i.e. varchar(20), decimal(12,2), etc...
int type SQL type.

Todo:
SQL type should be defined by the D DBI DBD interface spec, therefore each DBD module will act exactly alike.
